name: Carrier Command: Gaea Mission
description: A next-gen re-imagination of a groundbreaking 80s classic. Carrier Command: Gaea Mission brings a breathtaking combination of action and strategy elements.

reviews.review_text: Pros: - Love the look, graphics are neat (if a bit 2005), great atmospherics and an overall joy to look at - vehicles are well-designed too; not too gimicky and far-out future-feel, it's all nicely balanced.  - The whole concept of controlling your units from the carrier, but being able to control and individual unit when needed, is fantastic! Definitely needs a polish, but the core mechanic is down - and it's a joy to mess around with!  Cons: - The AI in particular drives me up (and into) the f**king wall! Losing missions because your blonde-driver Walruses can't drive 10m forwards and shoot the enemy, without backing up 50m, turning around three times, getting stuck in a wall, and being slammed into by my other Walruses... ♥♥♥♥ gets old REAL quick.  - The infantry feel of the game is just horrid - ♥♥♥♥♥♥ guns, movement feels too fast, and still glitches in random places, slowing you down and making progress difficult. It doesn't even feel unfinished - it feels broken.   Conclusion: Would not recommend. Too incomplete, and AI kills the mood completely.

One word: AVOID.  This is a game utterly ruined by the unbelievably stupid AI used to 'control' your units when you aren't in direct control yourself. The pathfinding is terrible, the combat logic is nonexistent - I regularly found my units being picked apart by enemies they weren't even returning fire at, despite having clear lines of sight) The crying shame is THIS HAS BEEN DONE SO MUCH BETTER BEFORE BY 'HOSTILE WATERS' : A GAME OUT IN 2001!  Just take that in for a second - a game over a decade old, does a better job of this on almost every front. Use THIS game engine and give us the HD re-release of Hostile Waters i've been dying to see, that would have been a much better use of the man hours used to make this abomination.  If you haven't already played Hostile Waters, go get that instead - it's probably harder to get running on modern systems but aside from graphically it's a much _MUCH_ better game.

A rough gem. Could have been a new franchise ala battlefield with some more love imho, but sadly it wasn't so. It shipped with a few annoying bugs which are mostly fixed today. It has the occassional, though predictive, crash, however II only started to experience those during the later half of the game (after 25 hours of gameplay or so). Pathfinding issues have mostly been resolved, with a few minor exceptions. These issues aside, this game is totally awesome and well worth the €25 it is sold for today. I regret the fact it never got a successor, because the different concept applied in this game are quite awesome.  - Take a sip from your drink while your units do the hard work like refueling and moving to a far away position, and take control as soon as the action happens. - Everything happens realtime. Production needs to be planned in advance because its not instantly ready (for example the production of fuel so you can travel to a different island). And although traveling to a different island does speed up time, you'll have to wait till your ship gets there. As a side effect: there is no loading screen. - Though the amount of different units are rather limiting (though somewhat understandable considering you're commanding a carrier), there are many different upgrades to choose from. - You'll have to take care of some of the logistics yourself, which adds to realism.

Great open world game. Love it... The map is huge, You got your own carrier, own army and conquer the world with it. What else you want? Sometime there is a little annoying glitch but well nothing is perfect. overall this game does really represent the open world games with the crazy graphics and an outstanding realistic weather system.

Personally I couldn't get through the first level of the campaign.  The FPS feel is very clunky and mouse sensitivity was horrible to get used to (never encountered anything like it before) and something about the 'feel' of the first person has made me feel rather sick; yes, physically nauseous which I've never experienced before while playing a game and hence why I put it down so fast.  Story seems very badly crafted story with no real reason for me to care why things are happening. It paints out Asia/Pacific as the bad guys and the more western US as the good guys (wow surprise surprise) and you’re fighting over water on some planet that’s not earth but like earth with earth-like animal’s… but it’s not earth. For some reason they don’t really explain what’s happening and the game seems like it’s a remake for a generation who had played it in the past and want to play it again. This game is NOT designed for those that haven’t played the original in my opinion.  Overall I wouldn’t buy this again; in fact I’d like a refund of my money and time now that I think about it…  Gameplay: 2/10 Graphics: 8/10 Sound: 5/10 Overall: 5/10

Played it first on the xbox and it was fantastic, now I see that it's constantly updated and the PC readily gets updates to make things function better. it's so in depth so that as a strategist, it really challenges you not to steam roll like in most RTS games and not to just rush in guns blazing like most shooters. I'm also still astounded by the fact that there's many different weather conditions that affect you, not only in vehicle performance, but for the visual aspect of it, like the fact that a rainstorm makes it harder for you as a player to see what you're doing and the psychological aspect is ESPECIALLY delivered with the weather and environmental depth of the game. very well done!

Overall the Game is okie but nothing special, but its not something I think I can really recommend because of its shortcommings.  Though if you can pick it up cheap you may feel it worthwhile.

Very Good Game Experience! It's not the HARD person shooter or the Very Specific Simulator of any type. But It's a very good MULTIPLE game experience. The KEY of the game is COMMAND. Strategy otherwise!  It's the control of multiple units to a purpose and the complete gamma of units making war. It's like playing a strategy game like StarCraft giving orders in real time viewing the battlefield from the inside! Another good option you have in this game is taking control of the units and playing as an FPS. The ideology is like Hostile Waters, another very good game of the same kind.   The difference between those games are that Hostile Waters had any unit with a specific pilot model called AI. The AI as much missions completes , so much its abilities raise(RPG style). In Carrier Command there is the ideology of complete control through the carrier. SO there is no indidually AI. Just you taking control a specific unit and the others that work automatically. In Hostile Waters AIs was like agents. In Carrier Command we talk about small army.  But as much some people compare it to ARMA game, NO. The Command interface make it a completely different game. Other 'Feel'.  Play the DEMO. It's really worth it.

Got hit by a train and thrown out of the map. Ran for 2 minutes trying to find a way out and realized im just glitched. Uninstalled the game.  I'm assuming it was the tutorial? It was within the first half hour of game play. Anyway the game starts with the a very poor FPS where you can't jump or look completely down or up. The mouse sensitivity as stated but numerous others, is horribly high. I found myself attempting to turn right and looking directly backwards without realizing. Yes its adjustable just a bad start. Anyway, the story from what i saw was stale and the voice acting as stated before was ♥♥♥♥ poor. I purchased the game on sale for 6$ i think, but i regret that. To sum up my review of this game. No, just no.  Pros:  Trailer looked awesome.  Cons. Poor voice acting,  poor controls,  poor mechanics,  can't jump,  glitched out of the game within 30min of game play and had to restart,  stale story line (From what i saw),  not allowing you to go somewhere even though theres a clear path but a small knee high rock blocking 1/3 of your path.

Graphics - For the most part you get what you would expect but nothing that would impress you. At times the lighting effects are blinding when the game time is around dusk or dawn on some islands.  Gameplay - The FPS part of the game is good and nothing amazing but as for the RTS portion which comprises most of the game oh god its fun when the AI doesn't ♥♥♥♥ up. Realistically though the RTS portion is broken as even that is pushed to the wayside since you will find less frustration by taking 1 walrus(thats a tank) and playing it manually rather than let the AI do it as it tends to just lemming rush your tank into a firing squad showing its ♥♥♥ to them.  Story - Don't expect much as its quite cliche and the voice acting is not bad but not very good either  Game breaking bugs are something to be considered because in the game you have use the supply barque aka supply ship to resupply your carrier EVEN if you have docked at your supply island where you have all your gear. the problem here inlies with the supply ship which sometimes will glitch and be stuck and no matter what you do to try and trigger it to move again nothing helps. Only way to fix it is by loading an earlier save or starting a new game.    Overall was a great idea but due to the horrendous AI and the Supply Barque game breaking bug this game is impossible to enjoy.
